dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5566 IH: Water Infrastructure Resilience and Sustainability Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Carbajal (for himself, Mr. Valadao, Mr. Carter of Louisiana, Mr. Mast, and Mr. Van Drew) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act and the Safe Drinking Water Act to reauthorize certain programs for water infrastructure resilience and sustainability, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Water Infrastructure Resilience and Sustainability Act.

section.header: Clean water infrastructure resiliency and sustainability program
section.text: Section 223(g)(1) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1302a(g)(1)) is amended by striking 2026 and inserting 2031.

section.header: Drinking Water System Infrastructure Resilience and Sustainability Program
section.text: Section 1459A(l) of the Safe Drinking Water Act (42 U.S.C. 300j–19a(l)) is amended by striking 2026 each place it appears and inserting 2031.

section.header: Midsize and Large Drinking Water System Infrastructure Resilience and Sustainability Program
section.text: Section 1459F(f)(1) of the Safe Drinking Water Act (42 U.S.C. 300j–19g(f)(1)) is amended by striking 2026 and inserting 2031.
